meanings.definition: To give new life or vigor to
meanings.sent1: After a good night's sleep, I felt energized and ready to revitalize my garden.
meanings.sent2: The community center's renovation project aims to revitalize the neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: I tried to revitalize my old phone by giving it a new case, but it still wouldn't work.
meanings.sent4: The rain helped revitalize the dry, thirsty plants in the garden.
meanings.sent5: The fresh coat of paint helped revitalize the old house, making it look brand new.

meanings.definition: To make something active or lively again
meanings.sent1: The music at the party helped revitalize the atmosphere, getting everyone to dance.
meanings.sent2: Exercise can help revitalize your body and mind after a long day of work.
meanings.sent3: I decided to revitalize the boring meeting by suggesting a fun team-building activity.
meanings.sent4: The new playground equipment will revitalize the park, attracting more families to visit.
meanings.sent5: A cup of coffee in the morning can revitalize your energy and help you start the day.
